Blusukan ke Majalengka, Wamen Budi Arie Setiadi Tanggapi Dugaan Adanya Desa Fiktif Terima Bantuan
06 Nov 2019, 09:21 by Tati Purnawati
MAJALENGKA, (PR).- Kementerian Desa Tertinggal dan Transmigrasi jawab dugaan adanya desa fiktif, seperti kata Menteri Keuangan, Sri Mulyani. Seperti diberitakan Kantor Berita Antara, Sri Mulyani di depan anggota Komisi XI DPR, Jakarta, Senin 4 November 2019, mengungkapkan ada laporan banyak desa baru tak berpenduduk yang dibentuk. Tujuannya agar bisa mendapat kucuran dana desa secara rutin tiap tahun.
"Kami mendengar beberapa masukan karena adanya transfer ajeg dari APBN sehingga sekarang muncul desa-desa baru yang bahkan tidak ada penduduknya, hanya untuk bisa mendapatkan (dana desa)," ujar Sri Mulyani.
Keberadaan aliran uang dana desa yang rutin dikucurkan ini, menurut Sri Mulyani, membuat pihak-pihak tidak bertanggung jawab memanfaatkan momentum dengan membentuk desa baru.
Wakil Menteri Pembangunan Desa Tertinggal dan Transmigrasi Budi Arie Setiadi menyebut dugaan itu benar. Soalnya, banyak desa yang hanya dihuni masyarakatnya pada malam hari, karena pada siang hari masyarakatnya nyaris tidak pernah ada di rumah. Semua berkebun, dan baru pada sore hari mereka kembali ke rumah.
Akan tetapi ia berjanji, pihaknya berupaya mengevaluasi desa-desa tersebut agar tidak berbuntut pada kasus hukum seperti penggelapan dana bantuan.
Hal tersebut disampaikannya saat berkunjung di Kabupaten Majalengka, Rabu 6 November 2019. Ia endatangi sejumlah desa yang ada di Kabupaten Majalengka.
“Untuk penertiban administrasi desa tentu bukan kewenangan Kementrian PDTT, itu tugasnya di kementrian lain. Tapi kami bersama kementrian lain berupaya mengevaluasinya dan mengaudit,” ucapnya.
Ada 15 desa fiktif
Budi Arie Setiadi tidak menjelaskan secara rinci di mana saja desa fiktif yang menurutnya berjumlah 15 tersebut. Hanya dia menyebutkan, desa fiktif  tersebut sudah ada sejak Tahun 2015 lalu. Di Pulau Jawa hanya ada desa di Sidoarjo yang masyarakatnya eksodus karena  menjadi korban Lapindo, dan  mereka pindah tidak berkumpul dalam sebuah desa seperti sebelumnya. Desa itu menurut dia, tidak lagi menajdi penerima Dana Desa.
Sedangkan desa-desa yang masyarakatnya hanya ada pada malam hari itu adanya di wilayah Kalimantan serta Papua. Desa-desa ini tidak dinyatakan fiktif karena masyarakatnya tetap ada dan desa tetap dihuni.
“Untuk 15 desa ini akan segera diteliti,  diaudit untuk mencari kejelasan persoalannya. Penangananya melibatkan beberapa pihak tidak hanya Kementrian PDT, termasuk Kementerian Keuangan, Kementerian Dalam Negeri dan sebagainya,” ujarnya.
Sementara itu kehadirannya ke Majalengka untuk melihat desa tertingal, namun saat berkunjung ke Desa Cieurih dia menyebutkan tidak masuk pada kategori tertinggal. Hal ini sehubungan kondisi desa telah maju, jalan menuju desa dari ibu kota sangat mulus, rumah-rumah penduduk juga bagus dan telah dialiri listrik, sinyal HP juga baik. Sementara yang dinyatakan desa tertinggal kebalikan dari itu.***

Blusukan to Majalengka, Vice Minister Budi Arie Setiadi Responds to Allegations of Fictitious Villages Receive Aid
Nov 6 2019, 09:21 by Tati Purnawati
MAJALENGKA, (PR) .- The Ministry of Disadvantaged Villages and Transmigration answered the alleged existence of fictitious villages, as said Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani. As reported by Antara News Agency, Sri Mulyani in front of House Commission XI members, Jakarta, Monday 4 November 2019, revealed there were reports of many new uninhabited villages being formed. The goal is to be able to get village funds regularly every year.
"We heard some input because of the steady transfer from the APBN so that now new villages are emerging that don't even have residents, just to be able to get (village funds)," Sri Mulyani said.
The existence of the flow of village funds that is routinely disbursed, according to Sri Mulyani, makes the parties irresponsible to take advantage of the momentum by forming a new village.
Deputy Minister of Development of Disadvantaged Villages and Transmigration Budi Arie Setiadi said the allegations were true. You see, many villages are only inhabited by people at night, because during the daytime the community is almost never at home. All gardening, and only in the afternoon they returned home.
However, he promised, he would try to evaluate the villages so that they would not result in legal cases such as embezzlement of aid funds.
This was conveyed during a visit to Majalengka Regency, Wednesday 6 November 2019. He visited a number of villages in Majalengka Regency.
"For the administration of the village administration is certainly not the authority of the Ministry of PDTT, it is his duty in other ministries. But we, together with other ministries, are trying to evaluate it and audit it, "he said.
There are 15 fictitious villages
Budi Arie Setiadi did not explain in detail anywhere in the fictitious village which according to him amounted to 15. Only he mentioned, the fictitious village has existed since last 2015. On the island of Java there are only villages in Sidoarjo where the people are exodus because they are victims of Lapindo, and they move not to gather in a village like before. According to him, the village was no longer a recipient of the Village Fund.
While the villages where the community only exists at night are in Kalimantan and Papua. These villages were not declared to be fictitious because the community remained and the village remained inhabited.
"For these 15 villages to be examined immediately, audited to look for clarity of the problem. The handling involves several parties, not only the Ministry of PDT, including the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of the Interior and so on, "he said.
Meanwhile his presence in Majalengka was to see the most populated village, but when he visited Cieurih Village he mentioned that he was not included in the disadvantaged category. This is due to the condition of the village has progressed, the road to the village from the capital is very smooth, the houses of people are also good and have electricity, the cellphone signal is also good. While the stated village lags behind that. ***
